float32.name: bounding radius
float32.description: world units

float32.name: acceleration scale
float32.description: marine 1.0, grunt 1.4, elite 0.9, hunter 0.5, etc.

float32.name: render bounding radius
float32.description: if set, this radius is used to determine if the object is visible. set it for the pelican.

bit.name: invert#result of function is one minus actual result
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

float32.name: period
float32.description: this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)

enum16.name: scale period by#multiply this function by the above period
scale function by#multiply this function by the result of the above function
wobble function#the curve used for the wobble

float32.name: wobble period
float32.description: the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble

float32.name: wobble magnitude
float32.description: the amount of random wobble in the magnitude

float32.name: square wave threshold
float32.description: if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

int16.name: step count
int16.description: the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)

int16.name: sawtooth count
int16.description: the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

enum16.name: add#add this function to the final result of all of the above math
scale result by#multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math
bounds mode#controls how the bounds, below, are used

int16.name: turn off with
int16.description: if the specified function is off, so is this function index

float32.name: scale by
float32.description: applied before clip, ignored if zero

bit.name: blend in hsv#blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space
...more colors#blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

float32.name: rider damage fraction
float32.description: what percent damage applied to us gets applied to our children (i.e., riders)

float32.name: distance of evade anim
float32.description: this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our evade animation to move us

float32.name: distance of dive anim
float32.description: this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our dive animation to move us

float32.name: stunned movement threshold
float32.description: if we take this much damage in a short space of time we will play our 'stunned movement' animations

tagRef.name: spawned actor
tagRef.description: actor variant which we spawn when we are destroyed or self-destruct

uint16.name: spawned actor count
uint16.description: number of actors which we spawn min

uint16.name: spawned actor count
uint16.description: number of actors which we spawn max

float32.name: spawned velocity
float32.description: velocity at which we throw spawned actors

float32.name: AI vehicle radius
float32.description: radius around this unit that the AI tries to avoid when entering it as a vehicle (zero = use bounding sphere radius)

float32.name: AI danger radius
float32.description: danger radius around this unit that the AI tries to avoid

int16.name: variant number
int16.description: variant number to use this dialogue with (must match the suffix in the permutations on the unit's model)

float32.name: grenade velocity
float32.description: world units per second

bit.name: first person camera slaved to gun.

float32.name: yaw rate
float32.description: degrees per second

float32.name: pitch rate
float32.description: degrees per second

degree.name: bank angle
degree.description: angle at which we bank left/right when sidestepping or turning while moving forwards

float32.name: bank apply time
float32.description: time it takes us to apply a bank

float32.name: bank decay time
float32.description: time it takes us to recover from a bank

float32.name: pitch ratio
float32.description: amount that we pitch up/down when moving up or down

float32.name: max velocity
float32.description: max velocity when not crouching

float32.name: max sidestep velocity
float32.description: max sideways or up/down velocity when not crouching

float32.name: acceleration
float32.description: world units per second squared

float32.name: deceleration
float32.description: world units per second squared

float32.name: crouch velocity modifier
float32.description: how much slower we fly if crouching (zero = same speed)

float32.name: jump velocity
float32.description: world units per second

float32.name: maximum soft landing time
float32.description: the longest amount of time the biped can take to recover from a soft landing

float32.name: maximum hard landing time
float32.description: the longest amount of time the biped can take to recover from a hard landing

float32.name: minimum soft landing velocity
float32.description: below this velocity the biped does not react when landing

float32.name: minimum hard landing velocity
float32.description: below this velocity the biped will not do a soft landing when returning to the ground

float32.name: maximum hard landing velocity
float32.description: the velocity corresponding to the maximum landing time

float32.name: death hard landing velocity
float32.description: the maximum velocity with which a character can strike the ground and live

float32.name: standing camera height
float32.description: world units

float32.name: crouching camera height
float32.description: world units

float32.name: standing collision height
float32.description: world units

float32.name: crouching collision height
float32.description: world units

float32.name: collision radius
float32.description: world units

float32.name: autoaim width
float32.description: world units

reflexive.name: contact points
reflexive.description: these are the points where the biped touches the ground
